description: Returns, adds, edits, and removes stream instances.

Href.description: Uniform Resource Locator (URL) that points another API resource to which this response has some relationship. This URL often begins with `https://cloud.mongodb.com/api/atlas`.

Rel.description: Uniform Resource Locator (URL) that defines the semantic relationship between this resource and another API resource. This URL often begins with `https://cloud.mongodb.com/api/atlas`.

BaseStreamsRegion.description: Name of the cloud provider region hosting Atlas Stream Processing.

StreamsDataProcessRegion.description: Information about the cloud provider region in which MongoDB Cloud processes the stream.

CloudProvider.description: Label that identifies the cloud service provider where MongoDB Cloud performs stream processing. Currently, this parameter supports AWS only.

Links.description: List of one or more Uniform Resource Locators (URLs) that point to API sub-resources, related API resources, or both. RFC 5988 outlines these relationships.

StreamConfig.description: Configuration options for an Atlas Stream Processing Instance.

Links.description: List of one or more Uniform Resource Locators (URLs) that point to API sub-resources, related API resources, or both. RFC 5988 outlines these relationships.

Tier.description: Selected tier for the Stream Instance. Configures Memory / VCPU allowances.
Tier.title: Stream Instance Tier

StreamsKafkaAuthentication.description: User credentials required to connect to a Kafka Cluster. Includes the authentication type, as well as the parameters for that authentication mode.

Links.description: List of one or more Uniform Resource Locators (URLs) that point to API sub-resources, related API resources, or both. RFC 5988 outlines these relationships.

Mechanism.description: Style of authentication. Can be one of PLAIN, SCRAM-256, or SCRAM-512.

Password.description: Password of the account to connect to the Kafka cluster.

Username.description: Username of the account to connect to the Kafka cluster.

DBRoleToExecute.description: The name of a Built in or Custom DB Role to connect to an Atlas Cluster.

Links.description: List of one or more Uniform Resource Locators (URLs) that point to API sub-resources, related API resources, or both. RFC 5988 outlines these relationships.

Role.description: The name of the role to use. Can be a built in role or a custom role.

Type.description: Type of the DB role. Can be either BuiltIn or Custom.

StreamsKafkaSecurity.description: Properties for the secure transport connection to Kafka. For SSL, this can include the trusted certificate to use.

BrokerPublicCertificate.description: A trusted, public x509 certificate for connecting to Kafka over SSL.

Links.description: List of one or more Uniform Resource Locators (URLs) that point to API sub-resources, related API resources, or both. RFC 5988 outlines these relationships.

Protocol.description: Describes the transport type. Can be either PLAINTEXT or SSL.

StreamsConnection.description: Settings that define a connection to an external data store.

Links.description: List of one or more Uniform Resource Locators (URLs) that point to API sub-resources, related API resources, or both. RFC 5988 outlines these relationships.

Name.description: Human-readable label that identifies the stream connection.

Type.description: Type of the connection. Can be either Cluster or Kafka.

BootstrapServers.description: Comma separated list of server addresses.

ClusterName.description: Name of the cluster configured for this connection.

Name.description: Human-readable label that identifies the stream connection.

Id.description: Unique 24-hexadecimal character string that identifies the project.

GroupId.description: Unique 24-hexadecimal character string that identifies the project.

Hostnames.description: List that contains the hostnames assigned to the stream instance.

Links.description: List of one or more Uniform Resource Locators (URLs) that point to API sub-resources, related API resources, or both. RFC 5988 outlines these relationships.
